Subjective.History_of_Present_Illness: 21-year-old male presenting with headache and fever. Reports sensitivity to light (photophobia). Denies weakness on one side of the body or face, slurred speech, numbness, confusion, or changes in vision. Also denies experiencing the 'worst headache of his life'.

Diagnosis_Considerations: Headache (e.g., tension, migraine, infectious causes given fever)
Rule_Out: Meningitis (no stiff neck mentioned, but headache, fever, photophobia are concerning, though no confusion/numbness)

Plan.Next_Steps: Initial neurological symptom assessment concluded. Patient requires further medical evaluation for headache, fever, and photophobia.
Plan.Recommendations: Await handover for further assessment and management based on clinical findings.
